pros: It is a good place to work. Lots of faculty freedom without a publish or perish attitude.
cons: No endowment. Always struggling with undergraduate admissions.

pros: People in the entry level/admin positions are great to work with
cons: Poor leadership, not compliant, does not have a functional HR office, poor benefits, you will never get a raise, gender-based discrimination, under qualified leadership, rampant nepotism

review_title: Great team/coworkers but very dysfunctional university
job_title: International Student Coordinator in Harrisburg, PA
pros: There are definitely some great people to work with at the University across all departments, which was the best part.
cons: Overall it feels like a business and thinks of students as customers. Most of the students (especially grads) are international and it is where the University receives most of their revenue, but yet the International Student Office is underfunded and under-resourced.

pros: Salary, flexibility, lack of red tape
cons:
Quirky culture with growing pains

Insurance plan
Weak leadership, disorganized, doesn't manage change well, stressful working conditions. Doesn't offer affordable health insurance for family coverage.

pros: Good at gaining knowledge and enhancing skills
cons: University has limited projects and need more grants.

job_title: Academic Program Coordinator in Harrisburg, PA
pros: I really did not enjoy working here at all.
cons: If you're looking for an undefined role within a loosely defined university, this is your spot.

pros: It was fun to work for a university - there is always something cool going on at HU!
cons: Corporate is male dominated and very political. No flexibility with schedule.
